revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Jeff Green | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1964|02|23}} | birth_place = [[Chester]], [[England]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = Television, radio and stand-up. | nationality = British | active = | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = | signature = | website = {{official website|http://www.jeffgreen.co.uk}} | footnotes = | module = }} '''Jeff Green''' (born 23 February 1964 in [[Chester]]) is an English [[stand-up comedian]] and [[writer]]. He lives in [[Melbourne]] with his wife and two children.
== Stand-up == Green appears in [[stand-up comedy|stand-up]] festivals. His first solo tour in the United Kingdom sold out, and was broadcast on the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] network.
== Television and radio == His first TV stand-up show ''Jeff Green Live'', recorded at [[Her Majesty's Theatre]], was shown on the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] network on 29 December 1996. His second ITV show ''Jeff Green Up West'' recorded at [[Gielgud Theatre]] was shown in May 1997. Both shows were watched by over 3 million viewers. ''Back From The Bewilderness'' his third stand-up show recorded in 2003 at Gielgud Theatre has been shown several times on [[The Paramount Comedy Channel]].
He has appeared in several [[BBC]] television panel games and shows, such as [[Jo Brand]]'s ''Hot Potatoes'', ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]'' and ''[[Have I Got News for You]]''. He has also made appearances on [[ITV Network|ITV]]'s daytime show ''[[This Morning (TV programme)|This Morning]]'', on Australian TV in ''[[Spicks and Specks (TV series)|Spicks and Specks]]'' and on New Zealand TV in [[7 Days (New Zealand)|7 days]]. In 2002 he provided the voice-over for ''The Football Years'' on [[Sky One]]. In August 2007 his six-part series ''The Green Guide to Life'' was broadcast on [[BBC Radio 2]].
Green appeared in series three of the [[BBC Radio 4]] stand up show [[4 Stands Up]] in April 2009.
Green featured in a series of GCSE English Literature Podcasts for BBC Bitesize, and featured on ''Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow'' on 4 July 2009.
In 2010 he was a team captain on ''[[Bill Bailey's Birdwatching Bonanza]]''.
In 2018, he appeared on Royal Caribbean's Radiance of the Seas sailing the south pacific islands as the major headliner in the main theater.
== Writer == His first book, ''The A-Z of Living Together'' was a commercial and critical success, reaching the fifth spot of the ''[[The Sunday Times|Sunday Times]]'' Bestsellers List and remaining in the top ten for five weeks. His follow-up books were titled: ''The A-Z of Being Single'' and ''The A-Z of Having a Baby''. All three books have been translated into several languages including [[Polish language|Polish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], [[Finnish language|Finnish]], [[Serbian language|Serbian]], and [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. He has also written stand-up material for [[Jo Brand]], [[Jack Dee]], [[Steve Coogan]] and [[Lee Evans (comedian)|Lee Evans]].
==External links== *[http://www.jeffgreen.co.uk Jeff Green Official Website] *[http://www.comedy-zone.net/standup/comedian/g/green-jeff.htm Comedian Profile: Jeff Green] *[http://www.tv.com/football-years/show/14247/summary.html Sky One The Football Years] *{{imdb name|id=0337961|name=Jeff Green}}
